attributes.comment:
The USCIS has a history of increasing application/processing fees without
improving their quality or efficiency of their work. Even worse, with the
sky-rocketing fees, the applicants are suffering unbearably long waiting time
and low quality work everyday. How is the proposed fee increase justified given
the agency's history and current efficiency?

In the past and currently, many immigrant have expressed their willingness to
accept such fee increase IF THE AGENCY IS GOING TO IMPROVE THEIR EFFICIENCY AND
QUALITY OF ITS WORK. However, this has never being the case and does not seem to
be the case in the future, given the agency's history of building tremendous
backlog. I strongly OPPOSE the proposed fee increase.

Harry.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted By Anonymous
